item.title: TMCD Reading Group - Trinity 2019
item.description:
In Trinity Term 2019, the reading group will focus on Global Innovation and Technology Diffusion. We will meet on Wednesdays between 12 and 1pm in the meeting room at 2 South Parks Road. Papers will be presented either by one of their authors (in bold) or by me.

Schedule

  • 15 May: Yan, Pu, "Digital Divide in the Adoption and Use of the Internet in Everyday Life: Comparative Study in Rural and Urban Middle China".

  • 22 May: Haddad, Christian and Lars Hornuf, "The Emergence of the Global Fintech Market: Economic and Technological Determinants", Small Business Economics, 2018, 1–25.

  • 29 May: Shi, Liu, "Institutional Complexity, Soft Capabilities and Firm Innovation in Transition Economy: The Rise of the EV Sector in China's Automotive Industry".

  • 5 June: De Marchi, Valentina, Elisa Giuliani and Roberta Rabellotti, "Do Global Value Chains Offer Developing Countries Learning and Innovation Opportunities?", The European Journal of Economic Research, 30 (2018), 389–407.

  • 12 June: Mazzucato, Mariana and Gregor Semieniuk, "Financing Renewable Energy: Who is Financing What and Why It Matters", Technological Forecasting and Social Change, 127 (2018), 8–22.
